Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Stefand22
Reviews.Content: Really a horrible hotel, please do yourself a favour and don't stay here! How small your budget is, please look for something else!

Reviews.Title: “horrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Judy M
Reviews.Content: Just do do it. It is the most horrible place i have been so far in London, where i have to stay once a week for work. I woud give it a 0 rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Jana N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as a solo traveller. I paid for a single room but they offered me a double as it was more spacious with all my bags! The room was lovely if you aren't fussy and had all you really need in a hotel room- desk, tv, bathroom. I like the old traditional style hotels and its location was just perfect...2 minute walk to the tube, (Central line), 5 minute walk to Portobello Road markets, and surrounded by beautiful houses, cafes and parks (Kensington gardens and Hyde Park). Breakfast is included, very basic toast and cereal but the cafes are a 1 minute walk away! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “No one deserves to stay in this place, no matter how small their budget is”
Reviews.Author: aforeignaffair
Reviews.Content: The only 2 things I found ok about this place is their location (near the underground, bus stations, restaurants and tourist shops), and the neighbourhood (quiet, relatively safe). Yes, the room rates are cheap, but you also get cheap service and accommodations. The rooms are miniscule. Between the bed and the small dressing table, you only have room for one person to move around. The bathroom is so small you can touch both sides of the walls with only one arm extended. The "shower" is only as big as a large wash basin. You need to wait for hot water to come on for more than 5 minutes. The first single room they gave me had such an uncomfortable bed I had to request for another room, which they did, but the mattress was only marginally better than the first one. The walls need to be repainted. Breakfast is so basic, might as well go eat at the nearby McDonald's. Seriously, if you want to stay in the Notting Hill/Portobello Rd area, find another place to stay in. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “For Passing Out and Leaving Early ONLY”
Reviews.Author: larrydeluxe7
Reviews.Content: this is a relatively cheap hotel for the area, if one books it online through the right site. the room is for monks, and drunks,, the bathroom for the contortionist the constipated. the shower did have hot water (5-10 minute wait),,the bed mattress was probably made from the re cycled Corn Flakes boxes from the "dining room". Breakfast here gets the all star no where in the western world worst , cold old toast, instant coffee, mystery fruit cocktail, and the pre-mattress boxed Corn Flakes. Cannot beat the location, at the top of Portobello road,seconds from the Central Line tube, quiet, nice neighborhood, comfy TV lounge, pleasant employees. Basically dumped off bags, went out till late, crashed onto bed, woke up, left . 55 pounds, so far nothing communicable, no bed bugs. would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place for student budget!”
Reviews.Author: RousRauno
Reviews.Content: There were three of us, travelling with limited budget, and we wanted a decent, cheap hotel to stay in but with good location (tube station nearby) and own bathroom. And we got all that. Portobello road and Notting hill was a charmig area to stay on vacation, and it only took like two minutes to get to the tube station. There were also several restaurants and pubs from which to choose. The staff was very friendly and welcoming when we arrived, the receptionist gave us a map and explained the bus services and things like that. We were also able to pay the bill separately. Our room was a very compact one, with three single beds, a desk and a bedside table between two of the beds. We had our own bathroom, the shower was okay and we got hot water any time we wanted. Cleaning was good, our beds were done every day and rubbish took out. Breakfast was served in a spacious room, there were always free tables and room for us. We could have as much bread as we wanted, and there were jams, juice, cereals and tea and coffee. We had to check out at ten o'clock, but as our flight left in the evening, we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel, but with our own risk. This was a hotel that we could recommend and stay in again! :)

Reviews.Title: “What's a dump?”
Reviews.Content: This place! A total dump. I wish I had just stayed in the car. The beds are like concrete and the rooms are like a run down brothel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: 47308Brenda
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect. Only a block away from the tube and in a very comfortable & safe area. The staff at the hotel was nice & very accommodating. The hotel itself was adequate & my sense was that the staff was doing their best with the resources they had. Obviously, a bit of updating is needed. Would I stay there again? It wouldn't be my 1st choice, but I would. Our hotel need was to stay(sleep) in a safe & secure hotel. It met that need.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel in London! There are rats!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaKr
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying at this hotel. It's dirty, shabby, staff are very rude & I saw a rat running up the steps. It's something out of a horror movie. It should be reported to a health standards authority... Which I will do

Reviews.Title: “clean and great nieghborhood”
Reviews.Author: kristic28
Reviews.Content: At first glance i was unsure of this hotel but the family owners are very helpful and you can not ask for a better area to stay in. Tube station less than a block away, an easy walk to kennsington palace and hyde park. Great area restaurants & shops. and a decent price at 85 GBP. the rooms are aged but very clean....

Reviews.Title: “Just Enough”
Reviews.Author: MikaTokyo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not so gorgeous, but it's enough for the price. It was clean and convenient enough.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable”
Reviews.Author: kate76404
Reviews.Content: it is a bit shabby - no doubt about it, but not so bad. considering the price you get what you pay for. very cheap for notting hill. the location is unbeatable. cleanliness is OK as bathrooms and bed sheets are clean (don't look to close at the carpet though). the hotel has a lift and the building is a lovely (victorian?) building. brekkie is very basic, staff's fiendlyness is OK (neither outstanding nor horrible), the amenities quite outdated. biggest plus is the location, close to tube and bus routes, cafes and portobello market, hyde park etc.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathroom and in urgent need of restoration”
Reviews.Author: marilyn0749
Reviews.Content: The first impression was one of disgust. The bathroom was dirty with mould everywhere and a patch job of grouting. The toilet needed a bottle of bleach to clean the stains. The bed was very lumpy and we couldn't sleep. Windowsills hadn't been cleaned for a very long time. No tea making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, actually”
Reviews.Author: mpx23
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that after having read these reviews for the first time, i was almost traumatized. The only reason why I ended up going in the first place was because my best friend had already booked our room. At any rate, my first impression of the staff was that they were quite courteous and friendly, inviting me to stay and sit down to watch TV in their (small) lounging area while i waited for my friends to arrive from the US (the booking was under my friend's name, so i couldnt get the key). Going upstairs and into the room, i do have to admit, it had a musky smell - but after leaving the window open for the day, it was pretty much gone by night time. Showers and toilet were clean and worked well. Breakfast was simple, but generally quite decent and, to reiterate from before, the staff was quite friendly, often times going out of their way to help us. All in all, i have yet to find anything really negative about the stay. Looking back, I now have a hard time giving credibility to some of the unfairly negative reviews this hotel has received. Some reviewers are clearly too "stuffy" - complaining about the silliest things (too small an elevator, demanding fruit before breakfast when they don't serve fruit and so on). I'm not saying the hotel is perfect - far from it, but for a budget hotel (NOT 5 STAR HOTEL, FOLKS!) this is actually a pretty nice place to stay. Will certainly go again next time i'm in London. That is, if you're spoiled and want luxury or people, then Westin or Hilton might be better for you. If you're on a budget, then this place is more than worth a look in my honest opinion. Oh, one last thing to mention - when my two friends (both of whom also agree with my statement above) left, I shopped around for a cheaper place to stay. In spite of finding several, i chose to stay here. Why? well, i clearly found it to be more then worth while.... just my $0.02

Reviews.Title: “Makes Bates Motel look like four star luxury!”
Reviews.Author: laurabgreene
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying here! No more to be said. Checked in - saw the room - checked out! Words can not describe how bad this is.

Reviews.Title: “BIG mistake!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnelieL
Reviews.Content: No Frills is a compliment. Arrived and indicated upon check-in that we are in a hurry to get to an appointment, check-in was very very very slow. The lift is totally scary and only had space for 1 person with a small bag - should have told us to rather take the stairs, less effort and time. Got to the room, it was dreadful, old, stuffy and really not worth the money spent. We decided to stay out for the night as long as possible, NOT to sleep in the hotel. Had to leave half an hour prior to breakfast serving which starts at 8am. Upon enquiring if we could perhaps just have a fruit to take with us, we were 'reminded' that breakfast is served from 8am...But now reading the other reviews after our stay (big mistake), we were not missing much?! Very dodgy place, especially if one is used to some luxury. I will never ever ever return or recommend this 'hotel' to someone. It is a total rip-off!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here ...... if you are too drunk to see”
Reviews.Author: KWtoon
Reviews.Content: As we walked up to this beautiful hotel, I would have never expected the horrors that lay within. I said to my friend, 'well there are Mercedes parked outside so it can't be that bad'. How wrong I was. The check in process was straight forward, and the trip to the room resulted in my friend being momentarily trapped in the lift, much to the disgust of the staff member who's comforting words were 'it is very dangerous'. Yes, the lift is dangerous. The room itself could have done with a lick of paint, not least to hide the stains from damp - although I am not sure what to recommend to get the stains out of the bed sheets. The bare wires dangling from the ceiling, the broken mirror hanging precariously from the wall, and the bedside table with nails sticking out, all made for an interesting nights sleep. Helped along by the man in the next room vomiting all night. I was hoping that Ashton Kucher would jump out and shout 'punked' as I lay awake...all night. The bathroom, was very small however the shower itself was shockingly quite good. Of course there is a but...... there was an ashtray on the wall next to the toilet. Complete with ash. Either it hadn't been cleaned since the smoking ban came into force, or they don't mind if you want to break that particular law. I assume it's the former. We decided not to check out the offerings for breakfast, but did leave our bags there after check out. thankfully our bags were not tampered with and my friend did not unwittingly smuggle drugs to the Southern hemisphere as we had anticipated. Granted Â£60 for 2 people is a bargain in London, although one I shall not be taking up again. If you plan to get really drunk and vomit all night like the gentleman in the next room, I am sure it will be more than sufficient. At least we now know the guy on reception WAS being ironic when he said we were lucky to get the last room.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: Smoulinka333
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not so bad. When I read the reviews, I was quite scared. But I wanted to make a budget trip to London and did not wat to stay in the 6th zone. The staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were basic, but they are cleaning them requlary - I saw the cleaning ladies every day. Breakfast was very basic as well. Good if you plan to spend all day out doing sightseeing and then come back for a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: antorri
Reviews.Content: I never saw a worst hotel. It was dirty, old and everything was broken. The toilet was dirty an I had problems to open and close the door too. Really indecent! I stayed only the first night, then I requested to have my money back and changed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “shocking is all i can say!”
Reviews.Author: philpayne
Reviews.Content: this hotel is by far the worst hotel i have stayed at ever! all i can do is just mirror the other comments and add that we changed rooms three times and honestly each room was as bad as the other one room having no ventilation whatsoever and when i complained that i couldnt even open the window i was told well what do you expect for Â£70 a night............ shocking is all i can say!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: hotrods_n_curls
Reviews.Content: As this was a trip we wanted to do on a budget we picked this hotel, because of two things - cost and location. The location of this hotel / B&B is FANTASTIC! The tube is just 2 blocks away and it is on a quiet street. As to the cost - - you get what you pay for which is not much. Building was undergoing re-work so I can not say as to the current condition but it was dirty! the halls and main areas could use several galons of cleaner and alot elbow grease. Breakfast is cornflakes and canned fruit that is all. We bought fruit at a local stand and ate that as well each day. do take slippers as I would not want to walk barefoot. BUT the sheets are clean (not the comforters so the squeemish need not stay here) and the hotwater is pleantiful. We basically only slept here after a long day of sightseeing so we did not care much about anything but a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible standards - excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Engangskamerat
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at The Notting Hill Hotel, it might be one of the worst hotels IÂ´ve ever stayed at. The breakfast room is worth a visit alone: Old wooden carvings from eastern Europe making it look like a tasteless crypt, poor breakfast served in a dark room - and the plastic sheets on the tables have not been changed since they were put there. Underneath is a bacterial heaven, so to say. The lift doesÂ´nt work, the curtains hangs like shreds, the corner of our bed had some dried-up spillings on it. Was it puke? Was it sauce? I guess we will never know. The doorlock can be opened with a light kick. Everything is in such a bad shape. The standard of this place is ridicolous - so bad itÂ´s actually quite funny. But! The location and rate are excellent, we attended the Notting hill Carnival, and the hotel is located at the end of Portobello Rd, and considering the fact that you donÂ´t spend much time at the hotels in London anyhow, you will survive. But only close.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: blekkhuset
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I have stayed at in London, this is the worst, the filthiest, the dirtiest and worst equipped. I will never forget those shower curtains or the rim of dirt on the table in the breakfast room. The hotel must be a health hazard. Plus side? The TV worked, and the location is good. I canâ€™t think of anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Pay More and Go Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: jammer2010
Reviews.Content: Hotel didn't meet any of the speciefied services from the website. There WAS a TV in the room but it didn't work! There may have been Tea and Coffee making facilities somewhere in the hotel but they weren't in the room! No bracket for shower in room 23 so had to hold it over my head to shower. Plaster falling off walls and held together with sellotape......I kid you not! Spend a bit more and please stay somewhere else, I was lucky as this was only for work but had I been there with my family I would have been fuming.

Reviews.Title: “Notting Hellâ€¦. Run for the hills. Cheap and you still get less than you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: Member100
Reviews.Content: Where to start? Edited highlights include: Dirty, smelly, tatty rooms. Honesty, this place is revolting, I didn't even want to sit down or touch anything. The reception is filthy, threadbare, smelly and dank and so are the rooms. In the room there was a sign on the window saying â€œbroken, do not openâ€�. Hmm how about fixing it? The toilet is approx 1ft high so there is a nice drop to sit on it. Actually this may be the only clean place to sit though (my friends went and bought industrial quantities of disinfectant wipes). On a positive note, there are actually beds in the rooms which frankly was something of a surprise. Just donâ€™t take the cover off and look at the blankets though, you might be ill. They ask for payment upfront, for obvious reasons. I reckon the number of people who check out as soon as they have seen the room is close to 100% which must be the only way this place stays in business. Health and Safety would have a field day in hereâ€¦. I felt sorry for the people who worked there and even sorrier for my friends who had paid to stay. Honestly I have never been so glad to go homeâ€¦ and I wasnâ€™t even staying. Youâ€™d be better off in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Disgrace!”
Reviews.Author: gazwaldo71
Reviews.Content: Not worth going into detail, just don't stay here. As I left I said to the receptionist 'this place is horrible' she replied 'I know'

Reviews.Title: “Don't even go there”
Reviews.Author: didoprdele
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good location, but that's about it. The room we have been in was absolutely terrible, cartons hanging off, dirty and i wasn't even brave enough to open to wardrobes. The Bathroom was even worse. I would rather pay extra and stay in clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here...really!!”
Reviews.Author: danidiaz
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start...the room is small but this is OK for London, the bathroom was disgusting, the amount of mold in the tile and the shower doors was horrible...the location is excellent but is not worth a penny!! the staff was nice and the breakfast was only toast, coffee, juice, salami and cheese... Yes it was cheap to stay here but really if this is a business and they want people to come back they should clean a little better, there is no need for mold in the bathrooms, chlorine will clean this...

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: mw1977
Reviews.Content: We paid an exceptionaly cheap Â£120 for 2 nights bed and breakfast. A friend of mine booked it last minute but did not check the reviews. Have got to say that the only reason we stayed was not to offend my friend. This is the most tired place I have ever stayed. The receptionist bareley uttered a word then we were given our keys. As the lift only held one person at a time we made our way up the stairs. This was like climbing a mountain. Once we entered the room we were overcome by a damp smell. The bathroom looked like it had not been updated since the 1940s and was in need of replacing. The whole hotel is grey, grey, grey. In the morning we went down for breakfast. Continental?? 10 slices of plastic cheese, toast, tea and coffee. The saving grace was our location. Notting hill is a great location with plenty of nice bars and restaurants. Part of our group stayed in the Comfort inn which is about 10 doors up the road and for an extra Â£15 per night seemed by far the better option. .

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, shame about the room”
Reviews.Author: jp_from_paris
Reviews.Content: I agree with cornish_pastie's review about the room features... Impossible to close the window as the handle didn't work. In any case as the room was overheated and there was a plumbing problem making the room smell damp, it didn't really matter. On the other hand, the staff are friendly and the breakfast is basic but OK. Check your credit card bill afterwards as they had already charged for the room before arrival!

Reviews.Title: “More Nottinghill Hostel than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bristolmember
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed here over the Bank Holiday weekend in August as we were attending the Notting Hill Carnival. They put the prices up by Â£10 due to the fact of it being the Carnival- so we ended up paying Â£65:00 per room per night. We were quite disappointed with the layout of the hotel - very old fashioned with lots of strairs which were steep- the staff offered us the use of the lift there but it was so tiny and old we decided to use the stairs- as we were afraid that it might break down. The room was poor quality and very small. The beds were soft so I had an uncomfortable nights sleep there. The towels which they provided were old and messy. The bathroom was okay in size but the shower was too small - we both ended up with bruises and I hit my head on the tap a number of times. Room needs to be painted despartely and new furniture needs to be provided. It reminded me of an homeless hostel or bed and breakfast- I have been in a few in my line of work and I can say that this accommodation was on par with what is offered there. If you do go there please expect poor standard of accommodation! The only saving grace of the place was that the staff were very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Can only laugh!”
Reviews.Author: cornish_pastie
Reviews.Content: Remember the price! I kept saying to myself..... It is surely one of the cheapest stays in central London you'll find. I stayed with my wife and MiL for a couple of nights. The room was oh so tired - not dirty - just tired! The shower room was 'amusing' - it had a false floor in there but the toilet was clearly fixed to the original floor so you had a bit of a 'drop' to sit down and ended up with your knees a lot higher than you might be accustomed too! The bed side lamps were all hard wired so unless it was a bulb gone they couldn't easily sort out a reading light. The wiring generally looked a bit suspect with ceiling roses missing. But it was so bad it was good and we couldn't stop laughing each time some other quick came to light. But to put up 3 people within 5 min walk of the tube at what are basically hostel prices. With more notice you can get modern fresh rooms at something like the Travelodge but without the 'character'. Didn't even see the dining room!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research we believe this hotel was about all we could expect for the money in London. The staff made every attempt to accomodate us and the room was small (aren't they all in London?) but clean and properly made up each day. The location is great - a short walk from the Notting Hill Gate tube station. The only difficulty we encountered during our 6 day stay was from a bunch of noisy people next door who arrived at 2 am. The staff people called them immediatly and the problem was taken care of in reasonable time.

HotelInfo.Name: Notting Hill Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Pembridge Square | Bayswater, London W2 4EW, England
